Class ImageResizeUtil

extends Object
    Utility to resize images.
    Author:
    luc boutier

    • Method Detail

      • resizeImage

        public static BufferedImage resizeImage(BufferedImage originalImage,
                                        int width,
                                        int height,
                                        boolean preserveDimensions)
        Resize an image with default quality settings.
        Parameters:
        originalImage - The image to resize.
        width - The target width.
        height - The target height.
        preserveDimensions - Flag to know if we should preserve original image dimensions.
        Returns:
        The resized image.

      • resizeImageWithHint

        public static BufferedImage resizeImageWithHint(BufferedImage originalImage,
                                                int width,
                                                int height,
                                                boolean preserveDimensions)

        Resize an image with high quality settings.

        • g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_INTERPOLATION, RenderingHints.VALUE_INTERPOLATION_BILINEAR);
        • g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_RENDERING, RenderingHints.VALUE_RENDER_QUALITY);
        • g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON);
        Parameters:
        originalImage - The image to resize.
        width - The target width.
        height - The target height.
        preserveDimensions - Flag to know if we should preserve original image dimensions.
        Returns:
        The resized image.

      • computeDimensions

        public static int[] computeDimensions(int width,
                                      int height,
                                      int originalWidth,
                                      int originalHeight)
        Compute target width and height based on requested width and height but making sure the original dimensions of the image will be preserved.
        Parameters:
        width - The ideal (and max) target width.
        height - The ideal (and max) target height.
        originalWidth - The original width.
        originalHeight - The original height.
        Returns:
        An array of int that contains the ideal width and height to preserve dimensions.
